title: Process of Performing Intensive Devotional Service | Sri Vasudeva Keshav Dasa | SB 6.9.28-30
speaker: HG Vasudev Keshav Dasa

segments.key_quote: Surrounding and serving the Supreme Personality of Godhead, Narayana, were sixteen personal attendants, decorated with ornaments and appearing exactly like Him, but without the mark of Sri Vatsa and the Kaustubha jewel.
segments.summary: The speaker reads and translates verses from Srimad Bhagavatam describing the appearance of Lord Hari and Narayana along with sixteen attendants after the demigods offer prayers.
segments.transcript: Om Namo Bhagavate Vasudevaya. Reading from Srimad Bhagavatam, Canto 6, Chapter 9, Text No. 28, 29 and 30. Shri Shukha Uvacha, Iti Tesham Maharaja, Suranam Upatishthatam, Pratichyam Dishya Bhudabhihi, Shankachakra Gadadharah. Translation by His Divine Grace, A.C. Bhaktivedanta Swami Srila Prabhupada. Shri Shukadev Goswami said, My dear King, when all the demigods offered Him their prayers, the Supreme Personality of Godhead, Lord Hari, carrying His weapons, the conch shell, desk and club, appeared first within their hearts and then before them. This is no purport, so I'll read the next verse by myself. Atma Tulyai Shodasha Bhir Vina Sri Vatsa Kaustubha Pariyo Paasitam Unniya Nidra Shadadamburu Hekshanam Drishtvatam Avanosarva Ekshanah Lada Viklavaha Dandavat Patita Rajan Chaner Uthaya Tushtuvahu. Translation: Surrounding and serving the Supreme Personality of Godhead, Narayana, were sixteen personal attendants, decorated with ornaments and appearing exactly like Him, but without the mark of Sri Vatsa and the Kaustubha jewel. O King, when all the demigods saw the Supreme Lord in that posture, smiling with eyes like the petals of the lotus, they were overwhelmed with happiness and immediately fell down like rods offering dandavats. Then they slowly rose and pleased the Lord by offering Him prayers.

segments.key_quote: So in this chapter, Appearance of Demon Vritrasura, in just a few verses before, we saw how the demon Vritrasura appeared and under what conditions he appeared.
segments.summary: The speaker provides context to the verses by summarizing the events leading to the Lord's appearance, including the appearance of Vritrasura and the demigods' prayers.
segments.transcript: So in this chapter, Appearance of Demon Vritrasura, in just a few verses before, we saw how the demon Vritrasura appeared and under what conditions he appeared. Indra and all the devatas have lost their kingdom. So they are praying. They first, we know the whole story, that how they got Vishwarupa as their priest to help them and win back their kingdom. And then Vishwarupa was sikandhu. He was secretly offering the ahutis in the sacrificial fire. He was offering oblations to please the devatas, to please the Supreme Lord on behalf of the devatas and also on behalf of the demons. So Indra becomes angry and in a fit of anger, he beheads Vishwarupa, kills him. And then Vishwarupa's father, Tvashta, becomes very angry. And then Tvashta starts a sacrifice where he intended to produce, to generate a personality who will be the demon of Indra and will kill Indra. But the reverse effect happens because he chanted the mantra long instead of chanting the mantra short. So instead of, because of that mistake, the personality arose, a fearful demon who was supposed to be the enemy of Indra, but because the mantra was chanted wrong, Indra becomes his enemy. And so Indra, we will see later in the next chapter how Indra will kill him. So when this demon Vritrasura appeared, he was very, very powerful, very fearful, very vast, very ghastly. It was like appearing as if the whole universe, the whole creation will come to an end. And so all the devatas, they have no other option now but to seek shelter at the lotus feet of the Supreme Personality of God. They are offering prayers to the Supreme Personality of Godhead. So they have just finished offering their prayers and at this point of time, a wonderful thing has happened. The Supreme Personality of God personally appears. It's no ordinary thing. The Lord has appeared in His full form. Actually this chapter is called Appearance of Demon Vritrasura and there is also the Appearance of the Supreme Personality of Godhead, Hari and Narayan.

segments.key_quote: He appeared first within their hearts and then He appeared before them. This was the process of appearance.
segments.summary: The speaker explains the process of the Lord's appearance, first in the heart and then externally, drawing parallels with Krishna's appearance to Devaki and Dhruva Maharaja's experience.
segments.transcript: So these two verses are describing how the Lord has appeared. It says here, Abhud Aavihi. Abhud means He became manifested. He became visible. Aavihi means He appeared. And how did He appear? He appeared first within their hearts and then He appeared before them. This was the process of appearance. We have a very similar thing we see in Lord Krishna's appearance at the prison house of Kamsa in Mathura to Mother Devaki. Krishna also appeared in the same way. First He appeared in the heart of Vasudev. Then from the heart of Vasudev He gets transferred to the heart of Devaki and then He appears. So something very similar we are seeing here also. The Lord first appeared in the heart and then the Lord manifested Himself outside. And something similar we saw in Dhruva's also, when Dhruva was chanting the mantra Om Namo Bhagavate Vasudevaya. Actually the Lord appears first in His heart as a Paramatma. Dhruva could clearly see. And then suddenly His meditation on the Vishnu Murthi broke. He was seeing the Lord in His heart and then it broke and He was wondering where did the Lord disappear? And then He opened His eyes and He saw the Lord was right in front of Him standing in His beautiful form of Vishnu. So this Lord first appearing in the heart and then appearing, manifesting in front of the devotees is a very wonderful Leela of the Lord.

segments.key_quote: Here also the Lord has appeared with 16 more personal attendants. And there is only one difference between the Lord's appearance and the appearance of these 16 attendants.
segments.summary: The speaker describes the Lord's appearance with attendants, highlighting the distinguishing features of the Lord (Srivatsa and Kaustubha gem) and the demigods' overwhelming happiness and subsequent prayers.
segments.transcript: And the Lord appears like this to satisfy His devotees when His devotees are rendering pure devotional service. It's not an ordinary thing for the Lord to appear. It's an extraordinary thing. And here, how the Lord has appeared. He has not just appeared alone like Prabhupada says, when the King goes, the King doesn't go alone. The King goes with His whole entourage. And so, here also the Lord has appeared with 16 more personal attendants. And there is only one difference between the Lord's appearance and the appearance of these 16 attendants. That is, because in the Vaikuntha planet everybody has features of Lord Vishnu, the four-handed form. But to distinguish between the Lord's associates, the Lord's devotees in the Vaikuntha and the Lord Himself, there has to be some demarcation that He is the Supreme Lord. Because everybody there appears with four hands, with a helmet and with everything. The only differentiating factor is that the Lord has two features which none of His associates have in Vaikuntha. And what are those two features? He has the Srivatsa mark on His chest. Srivatsa is a tuft of, a curl of white hair on His chest. And He has the beautiful, valuable, magnificent Kaustubha gem, the jewel, which is suspended on His neck and which is hanging on His chest. So, when He appeared, surrounding and serving the Supreme Personality of Godhead, Narayana, were 16 personal attendants decorated with ornaments and appearing exactly like Him, but without the mark of Srivatsa and Kaustubha jewel. And all the devatas were so overwhelmed with happiness. Ekshana, by seeing the Lord Sarve Ahalada. They were all filled with happiness. Ahalada means they were so happy. Imagine the Lord has appeared in front of them. And what happened? They were overwhelmed. Viklavaha, overwhelmed. And so in that state of happiness and overwhelming happiness, what did they do? Dandavat Patithaha. Patithaha means they fell down and they offered dandavats to the Lord. And then they shanahi, they slowly utthaya, they slowly got up after offering dandavats and once again they started tushtuvuhu, they started offering prayers. So they offered prayers, the Lord was pleased and satisfied, Lord appeared and soon after that they offered the dandavats and again they start offering, glorifying the Supreme Personality of Godhead, Narayana with wonderful prayers.

segments.summary: The speaker quotes Lord Kapila's teachings to Devahuti, emphasizing that intensive practice of devotional service (Tivrena Bhakti Yogena) is the only means to attain the final perfection of life.
segments.transcript: Devahuthi and then here Prabhupada is translating Ti Vrena Bhakti Yogena like this Ti Vrena Bhakti Yogena Manomai Arpitam Sthiram. So Kapila is talking about the final perfection in life and there is only one means to attain the final perfection so we should be actually hankering for this, I want the highest perfection and there is only one means that is Ti Vrena Bhakti Yogena, intensive practice of devotional service.
